page.title: 16Vegetable Growing, Boynton
page.content: Binsdale Farm is the only farm in our area which has fruit and vegetables for customers to pick themselves. It has a fruit field. There are five acres of strawberries. The two kinds are Tamellos and Cambridge Favourites. The strawberry plants last for four years before replanting.There are 4 acres of land planted with cabbages, cauliflowers, potatoes, beetroot and calabrese. The farmer has a little ice cream trolley to sell ices to customers. He has a little caravan where he weighs the produce. The family takes it in turn to serve customers. Selling starts in July each year. Sometimes the farmer takes water from the Gypsey Race to water his vegetables.
